page.title: 07Dairy farming in Cumbria
page.content: All the farms in the block have dairy herds ranging from 20 to 120 animals. Most are Friesians, chosen for their high milk yield. The larger farms have modern milking parlours, smaller establishments milk in the byre with a pipeline to the cooler. On one farm the cows are milked into bucket units which are carried by hand to the cooling house. Milk is collected by tanker each day for delivery to a milk processing plant. Careful records are kept, and on the more progressive farms feed is related to milk yield. Nearly all the farms have increased their young beef stock to compensate for the reduction in milk quotas. Some farmers keep one or more bulls for breeding purposes, others rely on artificial insemination.
